title: 111_hr6365
content: The Act may be cited as the "Justice for Sergei Magnitsky Act of 2010". The United States supports the economic potential and democracy in Russia. Russia is a member of various international organizations and has ratified several human rights conventions. States commit to respecting human rights voluntarily. States commit to respecting human rights voluntarily through international agreements and treaties, which are essential for maintaining the stability of the international order. Human rights are a fundamental part of international law and are crucial for good governance, anti-corruption measures, and sustainable economic growth. The protection of human rights is not solely the responsibility of a country's internal affairs, especially when obligations are incurred under international agreements. Systemic corruption undermines trust in democratic institutions, the rule of law, and human rights protections. President Dmitry Medvedev has emphasized the need for zero tolerance towards corruption in Russia. President Medvedev acknowledges Russia's corruption issues and the need for accountability. He condemns the abuse of Sergei Magnitsky and calls for justice in a democratic society. Sergei Magnitsky's death in a Russian prison in 2009, linked to embezzlement from the Treasury, highlights the impact of corruption on human rights. Public officials from various Russian agencies have been implicated in serious human rights violations, embezzlement, and retaliation against whistleblowers. The Public Oversight Commission in Moscow concluded that Sergei Magnitsky's detention was a breach of his right to life, citing psychological and physical pressure in custody. They described the conditions in some prison wards as torturous and called for punishment of those responsible. Visa limitations imposed on certain individuals from the Russian Federation. Visa limitations imposed on individuals from the Russian Federation who engaged in acts causing the death of Sergei Magnitsky, conspired to defraud Russia of taxes, or are related to those individuals. The Secretary of State must make determinations within 180 days of the enactment of the Act, with the option to waive requirements in the national interest. The subsection will end when the Secretary certifies specific determinations to Congress. The Secretary has determined that the Russian government has conducted a thorough investigation into the death of Sergei Magnitsky, brought responsible individuals to justice, and made efforts to improve its criminal justice system in line with international standards. The United States government is confident in the transparency and lack of political influence in the investigation described. The Secretary of State will revoke visas of aliens ineligible under subsection (a). Terms in this section have meanings from the Immigration and Nationality Act. SEC. 4. FINANCIAL MEASURES. The Secretary of the Treasury can implement special measures under section 5318A(b) of title 31, US Code, for money laundering related to a specified conspiracy. Assets of individuals involved in the conspiracy can be frozen and transactions prohibited in the US or by US persons. Regulatory authority is granted to the Secretary of the Treasury. The Secretary of the Treasury has regulatory authority to issue necessary regulations, licenses, and orders for implementing special measures under section 5318A(b) of title 31, US Code, related to money laundering conspiracies. Violations of these regulations will result in penalties under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act. The provisions of this section will cease upon certification by the Secretary of the Treasury regarding the Government of the Russian Federation. The Government of the Russian Federation has conducted a thorough investigation into a conspiracy to defraud taxes on corporate profits. They have brought the responsible individuals to justice and strengthened statutory protections for whistleblowers. The US government is confident that their investigation was conducted properly, transparently, and free of political influence. SEC. 5. REPORT TO CONGRESS. The Secretary of State and the Secretary of the Treasury must report to Congress within 180 days of this Act's enactment. SEC. 6. EFFECTIVE DATE. This Act will be effective 90 days after its enactment. SEC. 7. DEFINITIONS. In this Act, the term "appropriate congressional committees" refers to specific committees in the House of Representatives and the Senate. The terms "financial institution", "domestic financial agency", and "domestic financial institution" have defined meanings. The term "United States person" includes citizens and lawful aliens. The term "person" includes US citizens, lawful permanent residents, entities organized under US laws, and individuals in the US.
